alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Menifee; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Powell, southern Menifee, north central Breathitt and Wolfe Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Valeria, or near Campton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valeria, Stoll and High Falls around 235 PM EDT. Campton and Calaboose around 240 PM EDT. Gosneyville, Stillwater and Vortex around 245 PM EDT. Trent and Baptist around 250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Landsaw, Hollonville, Simpson, Gilmore, Lexie, Upper Gilmore, Malaga, Rosefork, Shockey, Paxton and Moct. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 29 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in Red River Gorge should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
